summary: An email chain between FBI agents discussing the St. Thomas Jet Center's potential handling of Jeffrey Epstein's helicopter and their refusal to cooperate, suggesting the need for a subpoena to obtain flight records.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who directed another agent to reach out regarding the St. Thomas Jet Center investigation.

persons.name: Pat
persons.context: Interviewed by an FBI agent regarding Epstein's helicopter; identified as an employee at St. Thomas Jet Center.

persons.name: Pat Hatch
persons.role: Employee at St. Thomas Jet Center
persons.context: Listed as a contact at St. Thomas Jet Center, which is believed to have dealt with Epstein's helicopter.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose helicopter usage is being investigated; the St. Thomas Jet Center refused to comment on him.

connections.description: Sean directed an interview of Pat, the air traffic control employee, regarding Epstein's helicopter.
St. Thomas Jet Center, where Pat Hatch works, is believed to have dealt with Epstein's helicopter, indicating a potential service relationship.

events.title: FBI email regarding St. Thomas Jet Center investigation
events.description: FBI agents communicate about interviewing an air traffic control employee and contacting St. Thomas Jet Center regarding Epstein's helicopter, with the company refusing to cooperate.

keyFacts: The St. Thomas Jet Center is believed to have handled Jeffrey Epstein's helicopter, based on FBI interviews and phone calls.
The St. Thomas Jet Center refused to comment or confirm any information regarding Epstein when contacted by the FBI.
The FBI considered issuing a subpoena to the St. Thomas Jet Center to obtain Epstein's flight records.
The communication occurred within the FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force.
